results.title: Hobart
results.creator_credit: Donald Anderson, Eric Thompson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dept of Film Production, Hobart

Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Scenes illustrating daily life, industry, recreation and tourist features of Hobart, without commentary.

results.title: Heart of a city
results.creator_credit: Ralph W Peterson, Brian Chirlian, Ajax Films and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Documentary about Queensland’s capital city, Brisbane: the people, cultural events, city and environs. The role of government departments in the city including local government, council planners and Brisbane City Council. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Keith Loone.

results.title: Having a go: a look at small business in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Cassidy, Tony Coyte, Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents interviews with entrepreneurs from five successful small Australian businesses. Each provides advice on how to succeed while stressing the need to be fully informed and equipped with proper business skills. Highlights the importance of government sponsored small business agencies for providing information and training.

results.title: Hassles
results.creator_credit: Jason Ollivier, Ross Simmons, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which takes an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. The central character is a teenage boy who found the courage to give up heavy marijuana smoking. His motive was simply the challenge itself, but the price of his success is rejection by his lifelong friends and associates who accuse him of simply substituting one source of stimulation for another. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also ‘Thirst’ [012683] and ‘All in the same boat’ [012758].)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jason Ollivier, Ross Simmons, Robin Hughes and Film Australia

results.title: The Happy Island
results.creator_credit: Ann Gurr, Maslyn Williams, Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Gemo Island Hospital, Papua, seen through the eyes of one of the nurses. As well as general wards separate blocks for T.B. and leprosy cases are maintained and within them, three schools are run.

results.title: The Gourmet's Dilemma
results.creator_credit: Robert V Jenkins, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A light hearted yet serious educational production highlighting to new migrants the strict quarantine precautions necessary against Foot and Mouth disease and other animal diseases being introduced into Australia. The film was originally presented with the options of Greek or Italian narration, we follow Nino and his family’s passage to Australia.
Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection

results.title: Golf in Australia
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the wide popularity of golf in Australia, showing the variety of courses and outlining training schemes and other aspects of the sport. Concludes with scenes from professional tournaments.

results.title: Infected
results.material_description: video, circular screen, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Infected is a projected video installation about the nature of the physical body in the context of future technological possibilities, seen through dance and digitally manipulated imagery. The new bio-engineered body is still a sexual, stark, brutal, organic, pounding bloody system with ripping tendons. It is beautiful and repulsive, indulgent, curious, emotional, un/controlled, breeding, changing.

Gina Czarnecki is an artist originating from the UK whose films and installations have been exhibited widely across the UK and around the world. Infected continues her work around the visceral, biological and emotive body and its politics in relation to new technologies.

This video is made in collaboration with Iona Kewney, a Glasgow-based dance artist. It features a specially commissioned score by Fennesz, whose computer-manipulations of sounds derived from guitar and other acoustic sources have won him worldwide acclaim as one of the most innovative and important artists working in electronic music.

results.title: Goldtown
results.creator_credit: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fabulous town with the “golden mile” - Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, a goldmining town in the midst of a forbidding desert where the water supply is piped hundreds of miles overland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R. Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
